events.description: Gold climbed to around $5,000 per ounce, extending gains for a third straight session.
President Trump nominated Kevin Warsh as the next Federal Reserve chair.
The release of private payroll growth data which came in weaker than expected.
The release of services sector activity data showing an upside surprise.
Agreement to hold nuclear talks in Oman on Friday.

facts.fact_text: Gold reached approximately $5,000 per ounce on Thursday.

evidences.evidence_text: Gold climbed to around $5,000 per ounce on Thursday

facts.fact_text: President Trump nominated Kevin Warsh as the next Fed chair.

evidences.evidence_text: President Trump nominated Kevin Warsh as the next Fed chair

facts.fact_text: The ADP employment report showed weaker-than-expected private payroll growth.

evidences.evidence_text: ADP employment report, which showed weaker-than-expected private payroll growth

facts.fact_text: Gold posted its largest intraday rise since 2008 earlier in the week.

evidences.evidence_text: after posting its largest intraday rise since 2008 earlier this week

claims.claim_text: The gold price move was driven by dip buying following a historic pullback.

evidences.evidence_text: The move was driven by dip buying following a historic pullback from record highs late last week.

claims.claim_text: Markets placed greater weight on private indicators due to delays in US government data.

evidences.evidence_text: with key US government data delayed, markets placed greater weight on private indicators to gauge the economy

claims.claim_text: The upside surprise in the ISM services PMI indicates resilience in the services sector.

evidences.evidence_text: an upside surprise in the ISM services PMI pointed to resilience in the services sector

claims.claim_text: Washington has not ruled out military strikes against Iran.
claims.author: Washington

evidences.evidence_text: Washington has not ruled out strikes over Iran’s treatment of demonstrators and its nuclear activities

evidence.evidence_text: ADP employment report, which showed weaker-than-expected private payroll growth
an upside surprise in the ISM services PMI pointed to resilience in the services sector
US–Iran tensions lingered despite an agreement to hold nuclear talks
to gauge the economy and the Federal Reserve’s outlook, particularly after President Trump nominated Kevin Warsh
